text: Harold Victor Hadley (1895-1977) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s. Hadley was from Hurlstone Park, New South Wales and was a star in the AIF rugby league team that played in England during the First World War (1914-1918)AIF Project "Harold Victor Hadley" https://www.aif.adfa.edu.au/showPerson?pid=122148. He was graded at St. George team in the club's second season in the NSWRFL in 1922. He played three trial matches with the club before making his first and last appearance in the First grade team on 29 April 1922. Alan Whiticker/Glen Hudson: Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players, 1995. ==War service== Harold Hadley was a veteran of the great war. He enlisted in the AIF in 1915 and was a member of the 1st Battalion, 12th Reinforcement. AIF Project : https://www.aif.adfa.edu.au/showPerson?pid=122148 Hadley died on 20 June 1977 at Hurlstone Park, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herald - Death Notice : 21/6/1977 ==References== Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney Category:Rugby league centres Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian military personnel of World War I Category:1895 births Category:1977 deaths
